verdict.summary: Docker container health check is failing. The application inside the container is not responding to health probes correctly.

dead_ends.why_fails: Hides the real problem; orchestrators cannot detect failures

workarounds.action: Inspect the health check log to see exact failure reason
workarounds.how:
docker inspect --format='{{json .State.Health}}' <container_name> | jq '.Log[-1]'

This shows the last health check result including exit code and output.

workarounds.action: Exec into the container to debug the health check
workarounds.how:
docker exec -it <container_name> sh
# Then run the health check command manually:
curl -f http://localhost:8080/health
# Or whatever command is in the HEALTHCHECK instruction.
# Check if the process is listening: netstat -tlnp || ss -tlnp
# Check logs: cat /var/log/app.log

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Both relate to container health; container-unhealthy is the container state, healthcheck-unhealthy focuses on the HEALTHCHECK instruction output.
